page.title: 08Cardington Church
page.content: There was a church standing in Saxon times. The Chaucel was re-built in the 16th century and the rest of the church was re-built in 1900. There are 126 steps up to the top of the tower to the bells. The tower has 8 bells and they are loud and magnificent. The church's bells are known as one of the best rings in Bedfordshire. The Rev P.A.Tubbs has been in Cardington for 16yrs,but is leaving soon. Sunday service is attended by about 60 people, more at morning service. The parish extends over a wider area than Cardington (pop:260). The parish includes:Cotton End, Shortstown, Old & New Harrowden(as far as Bunyan Centre) and Fenlake (pop:4300). The Reverend Tubbs believes it is a task of building up community life, through the worship and fellowship of the church.
